item.title: PHASM: Haplotype-aware de novo genome assembly
item.description: PHASM is a long read de novo genome assembler that phases variants among chromosome homologues during the assembly process, and aims to output separate contigs for each haplotype. The main idea in PHASM is to build bubble chains: consecutive “superbubbles” chained together. While most traditional genome assemblers pop these superbubbles by only keeping the best supported path, PHASM finds k paths through this chain of superbubbles that best represent each haplotype.
